intro: Hetaeria pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf hetaeria, is a small, flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes many diverse and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
